intro: Terminalia chicharronia subsp. neglecta, commonly known as the Neglected Terminalia, is a deciduous tree native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elongated, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
